exposr 0.0.1
  • Reference

Plot Longitudinal Summary Statistics with Optional Smoothing and Confidence Intervals

Source: R/trendplot.R
trendplot.Rd

This function generates a plot showing central tendency (mean, median, or geometric mean) and associated confidence intervals for longitudinal data, with optional features such as individual-level data display, time binning, LOESS smoothing, and a count panel showing the number of observations per time point.

trendplot(
  data,
  time_var = "Time",
  conc_var = "conc",
  id_var = "Subject",
  group_var = NULL,
  show_individual = FALSE,
  connect_individual = FALSE,
  connect_central = FALSE,
  show_counts = FALSE,
  x_lab = NULL,
  y_lab = NULL,
  use_log_normal = TRUE,
  use_median = FALSE,
  iqr_range = c(0.25, 0.75),
  bootstrap_ci = FALSE,
  n_boot = 1000,
  time_tolerance = 0.1,
  bin_width = 0.5,
  smooth = FALSE,
  smooth_method = "loess",
  smooth_se = FALSE
)

Arguments

data

A data frame containing the dataset to be visualized.

time_var

Name of the column representing time (default = "Time").

conc_var

Name of the column representing the observation variable (default = "conc").

id_var

Name of the column representing subject ID (default = "Subject").

group_var

Optional column name used to group data (e.g., treatment group).

show_individual

Logical; if TRUE, show individual-level observations (default = FALSE).

connect_individual

Logical; if TRUE, connect individual observations per subject (default = FALSE).

connect_central

Logical; if TRUE, connect central tendency points by lines (default = FALSE).

show_counts

Logical; if TRUE, show number of observations per time point in a bar plot below (default = FALSE).

x_lab

Custom x-axis label. If NULL, defaults to "Time (h, binned if needed)".

y_lab

Custom y-axis label. If NULL, inferred based on summary method used.

use_log_normal

Logical; if TRUE, compute geometric mean (log-normal assumption, default = TRUE).

use_median

Logical; if TRUE, compute median and interquartile range (default = FALSE).

iqr_range

Numeric vector of length 2; quantile range for interval (default = c(0.25, 0.75)).

bootstrap_ci

Logical; if TRUE, compute confidence intervals via bootstrapping (default = FALSE).

n_boot

Number of bootstrap samples if bootstrap_ci is TRUE (default = 1000).

time_tolerance

Numeric threshold for time binning trigger (default = 0.1).

bin_width

Width of bins for time when binning is used (default = 0.5).

smooth

Logical; if TRUE, overlay smoothed trend line (default = FALSE).

smooth_method

Smoothing method for LOESS or GAM (default = "loess").

smooth_se

Logical; if TRUE, include shaded confidence interval for smoothing (default = FALSE).

Value

A `ggplot` or `patchwork` object.

Examples

library(datasets)
data(Theoph)

# Basic geometric mean plot
trendplot(Theoph)
#> Binning applied due to time variation > tolerance
#> Error in mutate(., Time_bin = cut(.data[[time_var]], breaks = seq(0, max(time_vals,     na.rm = TRUE) + bin_width, by = bin_width), include.lowest = TRUE),     Time_mid = map_dbl(Time_bin, ~{        bounds <- str_extract_all(.x, "[0-9.]+")[[1]]        median(as.numeric(bounds))    })): ℹ In argument: `Time_mid = map_dbl(...)`.
#> Caused by error in `map_dbl()`:
#> ! could not find function "map_dbl"

# Arithmetic mean with normal-theory CI
trendplot(Theoph, use_log_normal = FALSE)
#> Binning applied due to time variation > tolerance
#> Error in mutate(., Time_bin = cut(.data[[time_var]], breaks = seq(0, max(time_vals,     na.rm = TRUE) + bin_width, by = bin_width), include.lowest = TRUE),     Time_mid = map_dbl(Time_bin, ~{        bounds <- str_extract_all(.x, "[0-9.]+")[[1]]        median(as.numeric(bounds))    })): ℹ In argument: `Time_mid = map_dbl(...)`.
#> Caused by error in `map_dbl()`:
#> ! could not find function "map_dbl"

# Median with IQR
trendplot(Theoph, use_log_normal = FALSE, use_median = TRUE)
#> Binning applied due to time variation > tolerance
#> Error in mutate(., Time_bin = cut(.data[[time_var]], breaks = seq(0, max(time_vals,     na.rm = TRUE) + bin_width, by = bin_width), include.lowest = TRUE),     Time_mid = map_dbl(Time_bin, ~{        bounds <- str_extract_all(.x, "[0-9.]+")[[1]]        median(as.numeric(bounds))    })): ℹ In argument: `Time_mid = map_dbl(...)`.
#> Caused by error in `map_dbl()`:
#> ! could not find function "map_dbl"

# Median with bootstrapped CI
trendplot(Theoph, use_log_normal = FALSE, use_median = TRUE, bootstrap_ci = TRUE, n_boot = 200)
#> Binning applied due to time variation > tolerance
#> Error in mutate(., Time_bin = cut(.data[[time_var]], breaks = seq(0, max(time_vals,     na.rm = TRUE) + bin_width, by = bin_width), include.lowest = TRUE),     Time_mid = map_dbl(Time_bin, ~{        bounds <- str_extract_all(.x, "[0-9.]+")[[1]]        median(as.numeric(bounds))    })): ℹ In argument: `Time_mid = map_dbl(...)`.
#> Caused by error in `map_dbl()`:
#> ! could not find function "map_dbl"

# Individual data with connections
trendplot(Theoph, show_individual = TRUE, connect_individual = TRUE)
#> Binning applied due to time variation > tolerance
#> Error in mutate(., Time_bin = cut(.data[[time_var]], breaks = seq(0, max(time_vals,     na.rm = TRUE) + bin_width, by = bin_width), include.lowest = TRUE),     Time_mid = map_dbl(Time_bin, ~{        bounds <- str_extract_all(.x, "[0-9.]+")[[1]]        median(as.numeric(bounds))    })): ℹ In argument: `Time_mid = map_dbl(...)`.
#> Caused by error in `map_dbl()`:
#> ! could not find function "map_dbl"

# Smoothed geometric mean
trendplot(Theoph, smooth = TRUE)
#> Binning applied due to time variation > tolerance
#> Error in mutate(., Time_bin = cut(.data[[time_var]], breaks = seq(0, max(time_vals,     na.rm = TRUE) + bin_width, by = bin_width), include.lowest = TRUE),     Time_mid = map_dbl(Time_bin, ~{        bounds <- str_extract_all(.x, "[0-9.]+")[[1]]        median(as.numeric(bounds))    })): ℹ In argument: `Time_mid = map_dbl(...)`.
#> Caused by error in `map_dbl()`:
#> ! could not find function "map_dbl"

# Include count panel
trendplot(Theoph, show_counts = TRUE)
#> Binning applied due to time variation > tolerance
#> Error in mutate(., Time_bin = cut(.data[[time_var]], breaks = seq(0, max(time_vals,     na.rm = TRUE) + bin_width, by = bin_width), include.lowest = TRUE),     Time_mid = map_dbl(Time_bin, ~{        bounds <- str_extract_all(.x, "[0-9.]+")[[1]]        median(as.numeric(bounds))    })): ℹ In argument: `Time_mid = map_dbl(...)`.
#> Caused by error in `map_dbl()`:
#> ! could not find function "map_dbl"

# Custom labels
trendplot(Theoph, x_lab = "Nominal Time (hr)", y_lab = "Drug Concentration (mg/L)")
#> Binning applied due to time variation > tolerance
#> Error in mutate(., Time_bin = cut(.data[[time_var]], breaks = seq(0, max(time_vals,     na.rm = TRUE) + bin_width, by = bin_width), include.lowest = TRUE),     Time_mid = map_dbl(Time_bin, ~{        bounds <- str_extract_all(.x, "[0-9.]+")[[1]]        median(as.numeric(bounds))    })): ℹ In argument: `Time_mid = map_dbl(...)`.
#> Caused by error in `map_dbl()`:
#> ! could not find function "map_dbl"

# Grouped example with sleepstudy (lme4 package required)
if (requireNamespace("lme4", quietly = TRUE)) {
  library(lme4)
  data(sleepstudy)
  trendplot(
    sleepstudy,
    time_var = "Days",
    conc_var = "Reaction",
    id_var = "Subject",
    show_individual = TRUE,
    connect_individual = TRUE,
    use_log_normal = FALSE,
    connect_central = TRUE,
    smooth = TRUE,
    smooth_se = TRUE
  )
}
#> Loading required package: Matrix
#> 
#> Attaching package: ‘Matrix’
#> The following objects are masked from ‘package:tidyr’:
#> 
#>     expand, pack, unpack
#> Binning applied due to time variation > tolerance
#> Error in mutate(., Time_bin = cut(.data[[time_var]], breaks = seq(0, max(time_vals,     na.rm = TRUE) + bin_width, by = bin_width), include.lowest = TRUE),     Time_mid = map_dbl(Time_bin, ~{        bounds <- str_extract_all(.x, "[0-9.]+")[[1]]        median(as.numeric(bounds))    })): ℹ In argument: `Time_mid = map_dbl(...)`.
#> Caused by error in `map_dbl()`:
#> ! could not find function "map_dbl"
